title: The Chronicles of David Griffin: The Bargaining Avenger

story.text: In the quiet town of Midvale, David Griffin, a spry 71-year-old, was known for his excellent bargaining skills. On this day, he discovered a hidden ability to negotiate not just great deals but also peace between arguing parties, starting with his neighbors over a fence dispute.

Empowered by his success, David decided to refine his newfound power. He spent the day reading up on conflict resolution and practicing techniques on old unresolved debates at his local community center.

David's abilities grew, and so did his reputation. He was called to a city council meeting to resolve a heated argument about local funding. His effective, calm negotiation helped reach a beneficial agreement for all parties involved.

News of Davidâ€™s talents spread, and he was invited to a national conference to demonstrate his skills. Here, he successfully mediated between rival business leaders, preventing a potential industry-wide fallout.

The governor, impressed, recognized David as 'The Bargaining Avenger,' and asked for his assistance in a state labor dispute. With patience and wit, David helped forge an agreement between workers and management, averting a strike.
Buoyed by a week of successes, David took a well-deserved break, going to yard sales where he haggled not for profit but for fun, using his superpower to help sellers and buyers find fair prices.

Reflecting on his week, David realized that his age and hobbies were a unique advantage in his role as a peacemaker, deciding to dedicate more time to resolving disputes both local and potentially international.

ending: Thus, David Griffin found true heroism not in battles fought but in words wisely chosen and agreements well made.
moral: True power lies not in strength but in the ability to understand and reconcile differences.
